Graphic: This is the type of screen control that this line defines, if it's a new screen, then NEW must be the first line
The ID of the screen, used in the NEW control, also used by other screens to reference this screen
The graphic file image for this control, located in the Graphics/Screens folder, also used for text strings in text displaying controls
For controls that use text, this is the font they use NAME-LOCATION-R-G-B
NAME
LOCATION
R-G-B
text for control's tooltip id, defined in text database
For some controls this is the index, for the NEW control this defines how this screen is run
0 = Game paused 1= Game runs & drawn 2 = Game paused & drawn
x value of where to draw the control, based on a 1024x768 screen, for the NEW line this is the entire game base, for controls, it is based on the screen top being 0,0
y value of where to draw the control, based on a 1024x768 screen, for the NEW line this is the entire game base, for controls, it is based on the screen top being 0,0
width of the control
height of the control
graphic files can contain multiple graphics for controls, so this is the x value of where this control is based on the graphic file
graphic files can contain multiple graphics for controls, so this is the y value of where this control is based on the graphic file
Conditional statement that defines whether or not to draw this control
Conditional statement that defines whether or not to execute the function of this control, like disabling a button
functional call caused by activating this control, like pressing a button
first dependency
second dependency
an animated graphic with multiple frames, first defined line contains the information
Index
Function
Font: name of the frame, each sequence should have a unique name that is the same across all frames of this animation
1st frame has more in here NAME:TICS:FRAMES

Index: number of tics (60 per second) between frames
total number of frames in this animation sequence
